about.name: Abrar Jalal
about.title: Undergraduate Student at Boston College
about.description: Abrar Jalal is currently an undergraduate student at Boston College in the Morrissey College of Arts & Science. He is currently pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and a Minor in Mathematics.

news.title: Started working as a Teaching Assistant under the Boston College Computer Science Department.
Began volunteering for the Students for Good Initiative at Boston College
Began summer internship as a Software Development Intern at Sensitech Inc. in Beverly, Ma.
Joined Boston College's Computer Science Society.
Joined Boston College's Club Running team.
Selected into Boston College Computer Science Society's Mentorship Program.
Began working at The Market at Corcoran Commons for work study.

projects.title: Spotify Manager
projects.authors: Abrar Jalal, Scott Sieger, Andrew Greenwell, Mathew Scott
projects.source: Web Application Development, Professor Nam Wook Kim, Spring 2020
description: A frontend React.js web application that allows users to have more control over their music listening experience.By logging in with their Spotify credentials, users can view their top songs across various timeframes and automatically generate playlists from them. This app features fully responsive UI design, making it both functional and beautiful on screens of all sizes. Spotify Manager is still in a prototype phase with plenty of room for expansion, but it is currently deployed and available for use at spotifymanager.com.
summary:
In the Spring of 2020, I saw an opportunity to provide listeners with even more control over their music streaming experience. Although Spotify provides a great streaming platform, managing one's music library can be a tedious task at times. As a result, I built a web app that alleviates some of these frustrations by integrating with the Spotify API. This web app is still in a prototype phase with plenty of room for expansion, but it is currently deployed and available for use at spotifymanager.com.

Throughout the development of this project, I focused on honing the following skills:
  1. Designing and constructing user interfaces that look beautiful and function seemlessly on devices of all sizes.
  2. Interfacing with publicly available APIs by making HTTP requests, including 3rd party authentication services, and writing asynchronous javascript.

projects.title: Validation Package Generator
description: In this project I Implemented a full stack desktop application in C# to automate QA report packages from Jira. I designed a REST API based application utilizing asynchronous JavaScript and basic authentication. I also Developed a user-friendly interface on .NET framework and Windows Forms (Frontend). And I collaborated with a team of software engineers and quality assurance team in an Agile environment
projects.summary: Throughout the course of summer 2020 I focused on improving my technical skills. Through my internship I was able to learn a new programming laguage C#, as well as learn how to create a REST API based application. This was also my first time working in a collaborative programming Environment. Overall, during my short stay with the company the growth in my understanding of the industry and my technical skills has vastly increased

projects.title: Bulls and Cows Game
projects.description: In this project for my Data Structures course at Boston College I created a user-based game called 'Bulls and Cows' using Java. The presmise of the game is to discover what the randomly generated computer number is with 10 guesses. The only aide recived is a Bulls indicator (which means right digit and right placeholder) or Cows indicator (which means right digit wrong placeholder).
projects.summary: In the intitial stages of this game I had kept the size of the random integer fixed to 4 digits, however, since then I have added levels to the game and added more digits. Ultimately, the goal was to make it harder for the user to win as he or she progressed through the levels.
